verses.verse: Cast <S%H7971><s%> thy bread <S%H3899><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the waters: <S%H4325><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou shalt find <S%H4672><s%> it after many <S%H7230><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

Give <S%H5414><s%> a portion <S%H2506><s%> to seven, <S%H7651><s%> and also <S%H1571><s%> to eight; <S%H8083><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> shall be <S%H1961><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> be full <S%H4390><s%> of rain, <S%H1653><s%> they empty <S%H7324><s%> themselves upon <S%H5921><s%> the earth: <S%H776><s%> and if <S%H518><s%> the tree <S%H6086><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> toward the south, <S%H1864><s%> or <S%H518><s%> toward the north, <S%H6828><s%> in the place <S%H4725><s%> where the tree <S%H6086><s%> falleth, <S%H7945><s%> <S%H5307><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> it <S%H1933><s%> shall be.

He that observeth <S%H8104><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> sow; <S%H2232><s%> and he that regardeth <S%H7200><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> reap. <S%H7114><s%>

As <S%H834><s%> thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H369><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> is the way <S%H1870><s%> of the spirit, <S%H7307><s%> nor how the bones <S%H6106><s%> do grow in the womb <S%H990><s%> of her that is with child: <S%H4392><s%> even so <S%H3602><s%> thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> <S%H853><s%> the works <S%H4639><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> who <S%H834><s%> maketh <S%H6213><s%> <S%H853><s%> all. <S%H3605><s%>

In the morning <S%H1242><s%> sow <S%H2232><s%> <S%H853><s%> thy seed, <S%H2233><s%> and in the evening <S%H6153><s%> withhold <S%H5117><s%> not <S%H408><s%> thine hand: <S%H3027><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H369><s%> whether <S%H335><s%> <S%H2088><s%> shall prosper, <S%H3787><s%> either this <S%H2088><s%> or <S%H176><s%> that, <S%H2088><s%> or whether <S%H518><s%> they both <S%H8147><s%> shall be alike <S%H259><s%> good. <S%H2896><s%>
Truly the light <S%H216><s%> is sweet, <S%H4966><s%> and a pleasant <S%H2896><s%> thing it is for the eyes <S%H5869><s%> to behold <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> the sun: <S%H8121><s%>

But <S%H3588><s%> if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in them all; <S%H3605><s%> yet let him remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H853><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of darkness; <S%H2822><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> they shall be <S%H1961><s%> many. <S%H7235><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> that cometh <S%H7945><s%> <S%H935><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Rejoice, <S%H8055><s%> O young man, <S%H970><s%> in thy youth; <S%H3208><s%> and let thy heart <S%H3820><s%> cheer <S%H3190><s%> thee in the days <S%H3117><s%> of thy youth, <S%H979><s%> and walk <S%H1980><s%> in the ways <S%H1870><s%> of thine heart, <S%H3820><s%> and in the sight <S%H4758><s%> of thine eyes: <S%H5869><s%> but know <S%H3045><s%> thou, that <S%H3588><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things God <S%H430><s%> will bring <S%H935><s%> thee into judgment. <S%H4941><s%>

Therefore remove <S%H5493><s%> sorrow <S%H3708><s%> from thy heart, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3820><s%> and put away <S%H5674><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from thy flesh: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1320><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> childhood <S%H3208><s%> and youth <S%H7839><s%> are vanity. <S%H1892><s%>
